Early Access Review

NOTE: This game was given to me by the developer for review purposes. This did not influence my review in any way.

==========================================================
---------------------------------------OVERVIEW-------------------------------------
==========================================================Note: Into the Belly of the Beast is currently in Early Access. The version reviewed was released on 20160204.

Into the Belly of the Beast is a fairly slow-paced two-dimensional action/puzzle game with a unique premise: you play a strange skeletal worm-like sea creature who must rescue its children from a giant monster of the deep that has swallowed them -- and you.

The game was created in Unity using what I assume to be completely original assets and has very high production values. Although still in Early Access it has obviously been well planned out. This is not just another grab some free assets from the Unity store and bundle them together for sale as a game on Steam" game. No

----------------------------------------QUALITY-------------------------------------
==========================================================Graphics - The graphics in Into the Belly of the Beast are very pretty indeed. The game begins with a brief introduction in the sea

There are no boring still backgrounds here; everything pulses and wiggles and sways in the current. Still screenshots just don't do it justice.\n\nEven though the game is played in the 2D plane of the screen

==========================================================
--------------------------------------CONCLUSION-----------------------------------
==========================================================Into the Belly of the Beast is a very creative and highly original casual action / puzzle game. It's slow pacing and unique setting won't appeal to every gamer
